facts.text: The Philadelphia Union was founded on February 28, 2008.
The Philadelphia Union began playing in Major League Soccer (MLS) in 2010.
Subaru Park, the home stadium of the Philadelphia Union, is located in Chester, Pennsylvania.
Jay Sugarman is the majority owner and chairman of the Philadelphia Union.
Kevin Durant is a minority owner of the Philadelphia Union.
The Philadelphia Union finished as runners-up in the U.S. Open Cup tournaments in 2014, 2015, and 2018.
The Philadelphia Union finished as runners-up in the 2022 MLS Cup final.
The Philadelphia Union won the Supporters' Shield in 2020, marking the first in the club's history.
The Philadelphia Atoms won the Soccer Bowl in their inaugural 1973 season.
Bob Rigby became the first soccer player to be featured on the cover of Sports Illustrated following the Philadelphia Atoms' championship.
The NASL, which included teams like the Philadelphia Atoms and Philadelphia Fury, folded in 1984.
Major League Soccer (MLS) added Philadelphia as its sixteenth team on February 28, 2008.
The finalization of the Philadelphia Union was supported by a $47 million package approved by Delaware County politicians and Pennsylvania governor Ed Rendell.
In the 2010 MLS SuperDraft, the Philadelphia Union selected Danny Mwanga as the number one pick.
The Philadelphia Union played their inaugural game on March 25, 2010, against Seattle Sounders FC.
Sébastien Le Toux scored the first goal for Philadelphia in their home opener on April 10, 2010.
The Union's first match at Subaru Park was on June 27, 2010, against Seattle Sounders FC.
Zac MacMath was the fifth overall draft pick by the Philadelphia Union in the 2011 MLS SuperDraft.
The Union acquired shirt sponsor Bimbo Bakeries USA on January 11, 2011.
Philadelphia Union qualified for the MLS Cup Playoffs for the first time in the 2011 season.
The Union lost the first leg of the MLS Eastern Conference semi-finals on October 30, 2011, against Houston Dynamo.
John Hackworth became the Union's interim coach on June 13, 2012, and was given the role permanently on August 30, 2012.
The 2012 MLS All-Star Game was held at Subaru Park, where the MLS All-Stars defeated Chelsea F.C. 3-2.
The Philadelphia Union used the first overall pick to select goalkeeper Andre Blake.
The Union traded forward Jack McInerney to the Montreal Impact for winger Andrew Wenger on April 20, 2014.
Jim Curtin's coaching career with the Union began in 2014.
The Union reached the Lamar Hunt U.S. Open Cup finals for the first time in 2014.
The Union traded for forward C.J. Sapong from Sporting Kansas City during the offseason following the 2014 season.
The Union traded Sheanon Williams to the Houston Dynamo for allocation money, which was used to sign Swiss midfielder Tranquillo Barnetta on July 29, 2015.
The Union made their second consecutive appearance in the Lamar Hunt U.S. Open Cup final against Sporting Kansas City on September 30, 2015.
Andre Blake won the 2016 MLS Goalkeeper of the Year Award.
The Union reached the playoffs for the 2nd time in team history in 2016 but were defeated 3–1 by Toronto FC in the Knockout round of the MLS Cup Playoffs.
The Union introduced a snake mascot named Phang on September 10, 2018.
By July 2019, the Union reached first place in the Eastern Conference and had the club's best start to a season.
In the 2020 season, the Philadelphia Union won their first trophy by finishing top of the league standings and earning the Supporters' Shield.
The Philadelphia Union's head coach, Curtin, won his first Sigi Schmid Coach of the Year Award in 2020.
The Philadelphia Union's debut in the CONCACAF Champions League was marked by their first international win against Deportivo Saprissa.
The victory against Deportivo Saprissa marked Curtin's 100th win as head coach of the Philadelphia Union.
The Philadelphia Union lost to New York City FC 2–1 in their first-ever conference final match in team history.
On July 8, 2022, the Philadelphia Union defeated D.C. United 7–0, tying the MLS record for the biggest goal differential win.
The Philadelphia Union advanced to their first-ever MLS Cup final after defeating New York City FC 3–1 in the conference finals.
In the MLS Cup, the Philadelphia Union were defeated by LAFC in a penalty shoot-out.
The Philadelphia Union's name, crest, and colors were officially announced on May 11, 2009.
The name "Union" was chosen following a fan poll, with the other options being AC Philadelphia, SC Philadelphia, and Philadelphia City.
The Union's colors, navy blue and gold, represent the primary colors of the Continental Army's uniforms during the American Revolutionary War.
The team's crest features thirteen gold stars representing the original Thirteen Colonies and a rattlesnake paying homage to the "Join, or Die" political cartoon by Benjamin Franklin.
The Philadelphia Union's official motto is "jungite aut perite," a Latin translation of "join or die."
In February 2013, which team unveiled a third uniform commemorating Bethlehem Steel F.C.?
Philadelphia Union
When did the Philadelphia Union announce their initial sponsorship agreement with Bimbo Bakeries USA?
January 11, 2011
How much was the Philadelphia Union's sponsorship deal with Bimbo Bakeries USA initially valued at?
About $12 million
In what year did Bimbo and the Philadelphia Union renew their sponsorship arrangement for five years at an annual value of $2.3 million?
Which company became the official beer sponsor of the Philadelphia Union on November 26, 2014?
Dogfish Head Brewery
What is the name of the stadium where the Philadelphia Union play most of their games, as of 2010?
Subaru Park
Subaru Park is located at the southwesterly corner of which bridge?
Commodore Barry Bridge
Ahead of which season did Subaru Park undergo upgrades to enhance the matchday experience?
The 2025 season
The Philadelphia Union played their home opener at Lincoln Financial Field on April 10, 2010, against D.C. United.
The Union's first match at their official home, Subaru Park, resulted in a 3–2 win over Seattle Sounders FC on June 27, 2010.
The Philadelphia Union's training fields, constructed in fall 2014, are located right outside Subaru Park in Chester, Pennsylvania.
In 2016, the Philadelphia Union opened a 16,500 square foot training facility and offices in the former machine shop of the Chester Waterside Station of the Philadelphia Electric Company.
The WSFS Bank Sportsplex, announced by the Philadelphia Union in February 2023, is a $55 million indoor-outdoor training facility scheduled to open in 2024.
The Philadelphia Union announced on August 19, 2015, that they would operate a reserve team in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania, competing in the United Soccer League (USL) starting in 2016.
Bethlehem Steel FC's name, crest, and colors were officially announced on October 27, 2015, following a fan poll.
In December 2019, the Philadelphia Union announced that the Bethlehem Steel identity would be retired ahead of the 2020 season, with the club becoming known as Philadelphia Union II.
On December 6, 2021, Philadelphia Union II announced they would join the newly established MLS Next Pro.
The Philadelphia Union Academy operates a training and competition program starting with the Under-9 age group and running through Under-17.
MLS Next, an elite North American youth soccer league, was launched in 2020.
The Union Academy teams train and compete in Wayne and Chester, Pennsylvania.
Philadelphia Union midfielder Quinn Sullivan became the first Homegrown player to reach 100 MLS appearances for the club.
Quinn Sullivan debuted for the Union on May 1, 2021, against New York City FC.
On MLS Decision Day 2024, Quinn Sullivan became the Union’s youngest player to achieve 10 goals and 10 assists in a single season.
Brenden Aaronson transferred from Philadelphia Union to Red Bull Salzburg in 2021, and then to Leeds United in 2022.
Mark McKenzie, a Union Academy graduate, signed with Genk in Belgium in 2021.
The Union Development Squad (UDS) entered the United Premier Soccer League for the Fall 2022 season.
The Union Development Squad finished the regular season with a record of 9–0–3 in the Fall 2022 season.
In February 2023, the Union Development Squad joined the National Premier Soccer League for the 2023 season.
YSC Academy, a soccer-specific school for elite players, was founded by Philadelphia Union investor Richie Graham in September 2013.
The first graduating class of YSC Academy was in 2015.
The Sons of Ben, a supporters group instrumental in the founding of the Philadelphia Union, was founded in January 2007.
The Sons of Ben presented scarves to the ownership group at the Philadelphia Union expansion press conference in January 2008.
The Sons of Ben were present for the Philadelphia Union naming ceremony at City Hall on May 11, 2009.
The Sons of Ben's principles are to be loud, proud, smart, and passionate.
The Sons of Ben had over 4,000 members by 2023.
The Sons of Ben created a 20,000 square foot tifo display for the 2023 MLS Cup Eastern Conference Final.
The 'Help Kick Hunger' fundraiser has raised over $100,000 for Chester community food programs since its inception.
The Philadelphia Union's primary rivals are the New York Red Bulls and New York City FC.
The Philadelphia Union's first playoff win in team history was against the New York Red Bulls.
The Philadelphia Union's most meaningful rivalry in recent years has been with New York City FC.
The rivalry between the Philadelphia Union and New York City FC intensified after NYCFC controversially eliminated the Union in the 2021 Eastern Conference Final.
The Philadelphia Union defeated NYCFC 3-1 at home to win the 2022 Eastern Conference final, earning their first ever appearance in an MLS Cup final.
The Philadelphia Union has a smaller rivalry with D.C. United due to geographical proximity.
The Philadelphia Union considers the New England Revolution and Atlanta United FC as rivals due to intense games and controversial moments.
The Philadelphia Union has had eras of rivalries with the Seattle Sounders and LAFC.

The rivalry between the Philadelphia Union and FC Cincinnati intensified due to multiple high-profile departures from Philadelphia to Cincinnati, including former Union assistant coach Pat Noonan becoming Cincinnati's head coach in 2022.
Until the 2022 season, WPHL-TV and WPVI-TV were the main English-language television broadcasters for Union matches.
From 2023, every Philadelphia Union match is available via MLS Season Pass on the Apple TV app, eliminating blackout restrictions.
Union season ticket holders receive free access to the Apple TV MLS package starting from 2023.
Keystone Sports & Entertainment owns the Philadelphia Union, with Jay Sugarman as the leading figure of the ownership group.
Nick Sakiewicz's involvement with Keystone Sports & Entertainment ended on October 3, 2015.
Basketball player Kevin Durant became an investor in the Philadelphia Union on June 15, 2020.
Kevin Durant purchased five percent of the Philadelphia Union with the possibility of acquiring an additional five percent in the future.
Alejandro Bedoya holds the records for both the most games played (245) and the most minutes played (19,388) for the Philadelphia Union as of February 22, 2025.
Dániel Gazdag is the top goal scorer for the Philadelphia Union with 58 goals as of February 22, 2025.
Kai Wagner has the most assists for the Philadelphia Union with 54 assists as of February 22, 2025.
Andre Blake has played 246 games for the Philadelphia Union, making him the player with the most games played as of February 22, 2025.
Andre Blake has recorded 76 shutouts for the Philadelphia Union as of February 22, 2025.
The Philadelphia Union's soccer stadium is named Subaru Park.
Philadelphia Union was awarded an MLS expansion team on February 28, 2008.
The Philadelphia Union played their debut match on March 25, 2010.
Philadelphia Union's first home victory came on April 10, 2010, against D.C. United.
The Philadelphia Union's season-ticket packages were sold out as of May 20, 2010.
The Philadelphia Union unveiled a snake mascot named Phang on September 11, 2018.
Jim Curtin was named the 2020 MLS Sigi Schmid Coach of the Year on November 17, 2020.
The Philadelphia Union won the 2020 MLS Supporters' Shield on November 8, 2020.
The Philadelphia Union's team name was officially unveiled on January 23, 2010.
In 2020, which team won the Supporters' Shield? Philadelphia Union
Which team was the MLS Cup champion in 2023? FC Cincinnati
Who won the Supporters' Shield in 2019? Los Angeles FC
In what year did Inter Miami CF win the Supporters' Shield? 2024
Which team won the MLS Cup in 2010? Colorado Rapids
Who was the MLS Cup champion in 2014? New England Revolution
In 2021, which team won the Supporters' Shield? New England Revolution
What team won the MLS Cup in 2017? Toronto FC
Which team was awarded the Supporters' Shield in 2012? San Jose Earthquakes
Who won the MLS Cup in 2008? Columbus Crew
In which year did the MLS Cup not take place?
Which team was the MLS Cup champion in 2023?
What was the shirt sponsor for the Philadelphia Union from 2011 to 2019?
Bimbo
Who was the shirt sponsor for the Philadelphia Union in 2020?
Subaru
Which player from Denmark is listed as a forward (FW) for the Philadelphia Union?
Mikael Uhre
Which team won the MLS Cup in consecutive years, 2016 and 2017?
The Philadelphia Union won their first Supporters' Shield in the year 2020.
The Philadelphia Union won the Eastern Conference (Playoffs) for the first time in 2022.
Jim Curtin served as the head coach of the Philadelphia Union from June 10, 2014, to November 7, 2024, with a win percentage of 42.68%.
Ernst Tanner was appointed as the Sporting Director of the Philadelphia Union on August 9, 2018, and is still in the position as of the last update.
The Philadelphia Union reached the semifinals of the CONCACAF Champions Cup in 2021 but were eliminated by Club América with an aggregate score of 0-4.
Dániel Gazdag became the top scorer in the history of the Philadelphia Union with 71 goals from 2021 to 2025.
In the 2022 MLS season, Dániel Gazdag was the top goalscorer for the Philadelphia Union with 24 goals.
The Philadelphia Union achieved their highest average attendance in the 2023 MLS season with 18,907 fans.
Conor Casey played for the Philadelphia Union from 2013 to 2015, scoring 22 goals.
Ilsinho was a player for the Philadelphia Union from 2016 to 2021.
Fafa Picault was part of the Philadelphia Union squad from 2017 to 2019.
Sergio Santos played for the Philadelphia Union from 2019 to 2022.
